meanings.definition: To excessively promote or exaggerate the qualities or importance of something.
meanings.sent1: The company was superhyping their new product to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: Marketers often engage in superhyping to make their products seem more appealing.
meanings.sent3: The salesman was superhyping the benefits of the vacuum cleaner, claiming it could even cook dinner!
meanings.sent4: Her friends accused her of superhyping her baking skills, saying her cookies were just average.
meanings.sent5: The politician's team was superhyping his achievements to win over voters.

meanings.definition: The act of creating excitement or interest in something to an extreme degree.
meanings.sent1: The superhyping of the movie led to a record-breaking opening weekend.
meanings.sent2: The superhyping of the concert tickets caused fans to line up for hours.
meanings.sent3: The superhyping of the school dance made it the most anticipated event of the year.
meanings.sent4: The superhyping of the new video game made it seem like a life-changing experience.
meanings.sent5: The superhyping of the book made it a bestseller before it was even released.
